personal.name: Alex Morgan
personal.tagline: I build products that make sense.
personal.description: Moving beyond feature factories. I help teams find clarity in chaos and ship software that actually solves human problems.

seo.title: Alex Morgan - Product Owner & Strategist
seo.description: Product Owner & Strategist helping teams find clarity in chaos and ship software that actually solves human problems.

contact.status: Currently based in San Francisco. Open for remote Product Owner and Senior PM roles.

content.emphasis: Data is useful, but intuition is vital.
content.paragraph: In a world obsessed with metrics, we often forget the human on the other side of the screen. My work focuses on bridging that gap.

I don't just manage tickets in Jira. I manage alignment. I translate business ambiguity into engineering clarity. I believe that a "Product Owner" isn't just a backlog groomer—they are the custodian of the product's soul.

projects.title: Redefining Data Clarity
projects.description: We turned a clunky, spreadsheet-like interface into a narrative-driven dashboard. The result wasn't just prettier screens, but a 15% reduction in churn.

projects.title: 1-Click Checkout Initiative
projects.description: Friction is the enemy of conversion. By mapping the user journey and removing 4 unnecessary steps, we streamlined the mobile checkout flow completely.

experience.description: Leading the core platform team. Shifted the company focus from feature-parity to innovation. Championed the new design system adoption which improved dev velocity by 30%.
Owned the mobile roadmap. Launched the Android app from scratch. Implemented the first A/B testing framework in the company.
Bridged the gap between non-technical stakeholders and the engineering team. Wrote the specs for the internal CRM revamp.
